topic.title: Installing the Photo Album Application on Linux

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: Before installing the photo album organizer you must check that your computer fulfills some basic requirements.

li.p: The application needs at least 100MB free disk space. Ask your system administrator for help.

The application needs at least 100MB free disk space. To find the available free space on your disk, type df in a terminal and check that the partition where you want to install the program has at least 100 MB free space. You can see the free space in the Avail column.Filesystem Size Used Avail Use% Mounted on /dev/md0 73G 65G 4.3G 94% / /dev/sda2 92M 5.7M 81M 7% /boot /dev/sdd1 230G 31G 188G 15% /home /dev/sdd2 230G 153G 65G 71% /usr/local
The application needs at lest 1GB of total memory.
The CPU must be at least dual core at minimum 1.5GHz.

section.title: Installing
section.p: To install the program follow these steps.

ol.li: Download the Linux archive, then run the md5 utility over the downloaded file to check its integrity.
Using a terminal, change directory to /usr/local.
Make a directory photo-album, then extract the downloaded file here, using tar command.
Create a symbolic link from your Desktop to the executable script photo-album.sh
